text: Department of the Treasury Internal Revenue Service
This transmits revised IRM 4.17.3, Compliance Initiative Projects, Requirements.
This section has been updated with the following signiﬁcant changes:
a. IRM
–Added National CIP Database as a source to check for existing projects. b. IRM
–Clariﬁed CIP coordinator is responsible for managing data. Updated for data control guidance. c. IRM
–Added TE/GE. d. IRM
– Added TE/GE. e. IRM
–Updated references for security and record control guidance.
Compliance employees within all Operating Divisions.
Table of Contents
Approval Research of Existing Data, Similar Projects Control, Use, and Disposition of External Annual Reviews Quality Review by Disclosure Manager Privacy and Disclosure Security

) This section describes the requirements for: • Approval of CIPs • Research of existing data or similar projects • Control, use and disposition of external data • Operational and Disclosure reviews • Privacy, security and disclosure (
) The appropriate Manager/Director must approve all CIPs and extensions. IRM
, Procedures, for complete approval process procedures. (

) CIPs must be approved before compliance contacts are made, that is, before taxpayers are contacted by any means as part of a compliance including, but not limited to, taxpayer education, research, examination, or lection activity. (

) Valuable information may be obtained from existing data or similar projects. Research should be conducted to determine whether such data or projects exist. If a similar project is identiﬁed, the CIP coordinator should consider its methodology and results, if available, to determine how or if appropriate to proceed with the proposed project and document these in the Background Objectives section of the authorization request. Some sources of information on other projects include: • IRS Websites • Counterparts in other areas, functions, or units • Fed/State partners • National Headquarters Office of Research, Electronic Library • The National CIP Database or other internal databases (
) Preliminary research, that is non-taxpayer speciﬁc research, to determine whether there is potential compliance risk does not require an authorized (

) The CIP coordinator will control all external taxpayer speciﬁc data related to cases that are part of a CIP being worked by an examination or lection function. For further information on retention of taxpayer data or information, refer to Document
, Records and Information Records Control Schedule - Item
or Schedule

) Data can only be used for approved purposes. If new uses are developed data already acquired, a separate authorization must be obtained prior to beginning the new use. Approval, if appropriate, must also be obtained from the source who provided the data. (

) The SB/SE PSP Territory Manager; Field Case Selection Program Manager; LB&I Compliance Planning & Analytics (CP&A) function for LB& I; W&I Refundable Credits Policy & Program Management; respective TE/GE ance Program Manager; or equivalent, will conduct an annual CIP review. Other compliance employees may be asked to assist. The objectives the reviews are to evaluate: • Proper authorization and adherence to CIP procedures. • Compliance with Service policy and guidelines. Internal Revenue Manual
The appropriate Manager/Director must approve all CIPs and extensions. See IRM 4.17.4, Procedures, for complete approval process procedures.

Preliminary research, that is non-taxpayer speciﬁc research, to determine whether there is potential compliance risk does not require an authorized CIP.
Proper authorization and adherence to CIP procedures. Compliance with Service policy and guidelines.
4.17 Compliance Initiative Projects
Accomplishment of results appropriate to the resources expended. Adherence to privacy, security, and disclosure requirements. Merits of continuing ongoing CIPs.
Note: Items to consider include availability of resources, performance measurements and impact on compliance.

Reminder: The Field Case Selection Program Manager’s review must ensure the National CIP Database is current, accurate, and the content is ate for effective monitoring of expiration and termination dates of (

) Any issues identiﬁed or actions taken as a result of the review should be mented by the Program Manager (or equivalent) and a copy of the results of the review should be shared with the appropriate Headquarter Director sible for workload selection and delivery. (

) The disclosure manager may, as part of the normal quality review of evaluate the controls on third party return information used for CIPs and provide a written report to the PSP Territory Manager/ Program Manager, Case Selection, LB&I CP&A, respective TE/GE Compliance Program or equivalent. (

) Disclosure managers will, at a minimum, address the following questions during quality reviews: a. Was third party return information obtained which required the disclosure of internal data to obtain? b. Was required headquarters approval obtained through the submission of CIP authorization request as contained in this document? c. Is the information being appropriately safeguarded? d. Has the function complied with the terms of the approved CIP request concerning the intended use of the information and its timely ﬁnal tion? (
) The Privacy Act of
provides the legal basis for limiting the actions of federal agencies in order to protect the privacy of individuals. IRC
, dentiality and Disclosure of Return Information, provides for the protection as well as release of returns or return information. (

) Only the minimum data required to accomplish a task should be gathered. data must be appropriate, relevant, and necessary for the project. It must be protected against unauthorized disclosure and disposed of appropriately after is has been used for its intended purpose. IRM
, Disclosure of Official In- formation contains additional information. (
) Physical controls required by IRM
, Physical Security Program, must be used to protect taxpayer information. Additional information may be found in IRM
, Records and Information Management.
